graphicslib3D.light

Class Light

  • java.lang.Object
    • graphicslib3D.light.Light
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DistantLight, PositionalLight

    public abstract class Light
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the abstract base class from which different types of Lights are derived. It contains the attributes common to all Lights: a name and a set of ambient, diffuse, and specular reflection coefficients.
    Author:
    John Clevenger

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Light()
      Constructs a Light with default coefficients ambient = {0,0,0,1}, diffuse = {1,1,1,1}, and specular = {1,1,1,1} and a default name containing a unique trailing integer.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float[] getAmbient()
      Returns a float [] containing the ambient reflection coefficients of this Light.
      float[] getDiffuse()
      Returns the diffuse reflection coefficients of this Light.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the name of this Light.
      float[] getSpecular()
      Returns the specular reflection coefficients of this Light.
      void setAmbient(float[] amb)
      Sets the ambient reflection coefficients of this Light to the specified array of values.
      void setDiffuse(float[] diff)
      Sets the diffuse reflection coefficients of this Light to the specified array of values.
      void setName(java.lang.String newName)
      Sets the name of this Light to the specified String.
      void setSpecular(float[] spec)
      Sets the specular reflection coefficients of this Light to the specified array of values.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a String representation of this Light, including the class name, the Light's name, and the ambient, diffuse, and specular reflection coefficients of the Light.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Light

        public Light()
        Constructs a Light with default coefficients ambient = {0,0,0,1}, diffuse = {1,1,1,1}, and specular = {1,1,1,1} and a default name containing a unique trailing integer.

    • Method Detail

      • getAmbient

        public float[] getAmbient()
        Returns a float [] containing the ambient reflection coefficients of this Light. The returned array is a clone of the light's coefficients; changing the contents of the returned array does not affect the light.

      • setAmbient

        public void setAmbient(float[] amb)
        Sets the ambient reflection coefficients of this Light to the specified array of values. The provided array is cloned; subsequent changes to the provided array do not affect the light values.

      • getDiffuse

        public float[] getDiffuse()
        Returns the diffuse reflection coefficients of this Light. The returned array is a clone of the light's coefficients; changing the contents of the returned array does not affect the light.

      • setDiffuse

        public void setDiffuse(float[] diff)
        Sets the diffuse reflection coefficients of this Light to the specified array of values. The provided array is cloned; subsequent changes to the provided array do not affect the light values.

      • getSpecular

        public float[] getSpecular()
        Returns the specular reflection coefficients of this Light. The returned array is a clone of the light's coefficients; changing the contents of the returned array does not affect the light.

      • setSpecular

        public void setSpecular(float[] spec)
        Sets the specular reflection coefficients of this Light to the specified array of values. The provided array is cloned; subsequent changes to the provided array do not affect the light values.

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String newName)
        Sets the name of this Light to the specified String.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of this Light.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of this Light, including the class name, the Light's name, and the ambient, diffuse, and specular reflection coefficients of the Light.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
